traversalConstraints.sourceText: [{'condition': 'Subject is in Cohort 1 (Age >= 60)', 'path': ['Visit 1 (Vaccination 1)', 'Visit 2 (Vaccination 2)', 'Visit 3 (Blood Draw)', 'Visit 4 (6-Month Follow-up)']}, {'condition': 'Subject is in Cohort 2 or 3 (Age 18-59)', 'path': ['Visit 1 (Vaccination 1)', 'Visit 2 (Blood Draw)', 'Visit 4 (6-Month Follow-up)']}]

executionTypes.activityId: Physical examination based on medical history
executionTypes.rationale: The protocol describes this as a clinical assessment performed at the start of the study based on medical history.
Table 7 and Section 7.2 describe temperature ranges and monitoring following vaccination, which typically involves a continuous daily window of collection.
The investigator must contact the sponsor if an SAE occurs; this is a conditional workflow triggered by a specific event.
This is a specific data analysis activity performed once to compare cohorts.
The Schedule of Activities and Amendment 1 notes indicate this is a repeated activity at study visits with added flexibility in wording.

footnoteConditions.text: b. Control group after vaccination with PPSV23 at Visit 2.
footnoteConditions.sourceText: b. Control group after vaccination with PPSV23 at Visit 2.

footnoteConditions.sourceText: c. SAEs and newly diagnosed chronic medical conditions (NDCMCs) will be collected through 6 months a

footnoteConditions.text: 4. SUBJECT ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA This study can fulfill its objectives only if appropriate subjects are enrolled. The following eligibility criteria are designed to select subjects for whom participation in the study is considered appropriate. All relevant medical and nonmedical conditions should be taken into consideration when deciding whether a particular subject is suitable for this protocol. Subject eligibility should be reviewed and documented by an appropriate member of the investigator’s study team before subjects are included in the study.
footnoteConditions.sourceText: 4. SUBJECT ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA This study can fulfill its objectives only if appropriate subjects a

footnoteConditions.text: 1. Evidence of a personally signed and dated informed consent document (ICD) indicating that the subject has been informed of all pertinent aspects of the study.
footnoteConditions.sourceText: 1. Evidence of a personally signed and dated informed consent document (ICD) indicating that the sub

footnoteConditions.text: 2. Willing and able to comply with scheduled visits, treatment plan, and other study procedures.
footnoteConditions.sourceText: 2. Willing and able to comply with scheduled visits, treatment plan, and other study procedures.

footnoteConditions.text: 3. Expected to be available for the duration of the study and can be contacted by telephone during study participation.
footnoteConditions.sourceText: 3. Expected to be available for the duration of the study and can be contacted by telephone during s

footnoteConditions.text: 5. Adults determined by clinical assessment, including medical history and clinical judgment, to be eligible for the study, including adults with preexisting stable disease,
footnoteConditions.sourceText: 5. Adults determined by clinical assessment, including medical history and clinical judgment, to be

footnoteConditions.text: 6. Cohort 1 only: Female subject of nonchildbearing potential or male subject not able to father children; male subject who is able to father children and willing to use a highly effective method of contraception as outlined in this protocol until at least 28 days after the last dose of investigational product. Cohorts 2 and 3 only: Female subject of childbearing potential or male subject who is able to father children, and willing to use a highly effective method of contraception as outlined in this protocol for at least 28 days after the last dose of investigational product; or female subject not of childbearing potential or male subject not able to father children.
footnoteConditions.structuredCondition: (cohort == 1 && subject.fertility == false) || (cohort == 1 && subject.fertility == true && contraception.duration >= P28D) || (cohort.in([2,3]) && contraception.duration >= P28D)
footnoteConditions.sourceText: 6. Cohort 1 only: Female subject of nonchildbearing potential or male subject not able to father chi

footnoteConditions.text: 7. History of microbiologically proven invasive disease caused by S pneumoniae.
footnoteConditions.sourceText: 7. History of microbiologically proven invasive disease caused by S pneumoniae.

footnoteConditions.text: 8. Subjects who receive treatment with immunosuppressive therapy, including cytotoxic agents or systemic corticosteroids, or planned receipt through the last blood draw. If systemic corticosteroids have been administered short term (<14 days) for treatment of an acute illness, subjects should not be enrolled into the study until corticosteroid therapy has been discontinued for at least 28 days before investigational product administration. Inhaled/nebulized, intra-articular, intrabursal, or topical (skin or eyes) corticosteroids are permitted.
footnoteConditions.structuredCondition: subject.medication.immunosuppressive == false && (subject.medication.corticosteroids.short_term == true ? washout >= P28D : true)
footnoteConditions.sourceText: 8. Subjects who receive treatment with immunosuppressive therapy, including cytotoxic agents or syst

footnoteConditions.text: 9. Subjects with known or suspected immunodeficiency or other conditions associated with immunosuppression, including, but not limited to, immunoglobulin class/subclass deficiencies, generalized malignancy, human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infection, leukemia, lymphoma, or organ or bone marrow transplant.
footnoteConditions.structuredCondition: subject.immunodeficiency == false && subject.malignancy == false && subject.hiv == false
footnoteConditions.sourceText: 9. Subjects with known or suspected immunodeficiency or other conditions associated with immunosuppr

endpointAlgorithms.name: Primary Safety: Local Reactions
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Reported prompted local reactions (redness, swelling, and pain at the injection site) within 10 days after vaccination.

endpointAlgorithms.name: Primary Safety: Systemic Events
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Reported prompted systemic events (fever, headache, fatigue, muscle pain, and joint pain) within 7 days after vaccination.

endpointAlgorithms.name: Primary Immunogenicity: OPA Titers (Cohort 1)
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Noninferiority to 13vPnC (13 serotypes) and PPSV23 (7 additional serotypes)
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Serotype-specific opsonophagocytic activity (OPA) titers 1 month after vaccination.

endpointAlgorithms.name: Secondary Immunogenicity: OPA Titers (Cohort 2 & 3)
endpointAlgorithms.algorithm: Geometric Mean Titers (GMTs) comparison (Cohort 2/3 vs Cohort 60-64 years)
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Noninferiority to immune responses induced by 20vPnC in adults 60 through 64 years of age
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Serotype-specific OPA titers 1 month after vaccination.

endpointAlgorithms.name: Secondary Immunogenicity: OPA Fold Rise
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Fold rise in serotype-specific OPA titers from before to 1 month after vaccination.

endpointAlgorithms.name: Safety: Adverse Events (AEs)
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Reported adverse events (AEs) within 1 month after vaccination.

endpointAlgorithms.name: Safety: SAEs and NDCMCs
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Reported serious adverse events (SAEs) and newly diagnosed chronic medical conditions (NDCMCs) within 6 months after vaccination.

derivedVariables.name: Serotype-specific OPA GMTs
derivedVariables.imputationRule: Missing assay results will not be replaced or imputed. OPA titers below LLOQ handled per SAP.

derivedVariables.name: OPA GMR (20vPnC/saline to 13vPnC/PPSV23)
derivedVariables.analysisWindow: Visit 2 (13 matched serotypes); Visit 2 vs Visit 3 (7 additional serotypes)
derivedVariables.imputationRule: Missing assay results will not be replaced or imputed.

derivedVariables.name: OPA GMFR
derivedVariables.derivationRule: Geometric mean of the ratios of post-vaccination titer to pre-vaccination titer
derivedVariables.analysisWindow: Visit 1 to Visit 2 (20vPnC and 13vPnC matched); Visit 1 to Visit 3 (13vPnC/PPSV23 7 additional)
derivedVariables.imputationRule: Limited to subjects with nonmissing values both before and after vaccination.

derivedVariables.name: Proportion of subjects with OPA titers ≥LLOQ
derivedVariables.derivationRule: (Count of subjects with titer >= LLOQ / Total subjects) * 100
derivedVariables.analysisWindow: Visit 1, Visit 2, and Visit 3 (as applicable per serotype)
derivedVariables.imputationRule: Missing assay results will not be replaced or imputed.

derivedVariables.name: Proportion of subjects with ≥4-fold rise in OPA titer
derivedVariables.derivationRule: (Count of subjects with (Post-vaccination titer / Pre-vaccination titer) >= 4 / Total subjects) * 100
derivedVariables.analysisWindow: Visit 1 to Visit 2 (20vPnC and 13vPnC matched); Visit 1 to Visit 3 (13vPnC/PPSV23 7 additional)
derivedVariables.imputationRule: Missing assay results will not be replaced or imputed.

derivedVariables.name: OPA GMR (Age Bridging)
derivedVariables.imputationRule: Missing assay results will not be replaced or imputed.
